comment.author: 47572660@N08
comment._content: If we judge by the terrain, this is obviously at Coalcliff, near Stanwell Park, in Wollongong's north. The railway would have run down to the wharf, which was finished in April 1877, while the colliery was opened in January 1878. The last coal was shipped from Coalcliff wharf (see: www.illawarracoke.com.au/Coalcliff_Cokeworks_Site_Owners_... in 1912, so that narrows down when the photo was taken. I wonder how many runaways they had in that period?
